general_advisory: Cloudy weather is expected in upcoming days so farmers are advised to take precautionary measures to keep the harvested produce in a safe place. Regular monitoring against disease infestation in both field and vegetable crops is advised. Sowing of Rabi crops like Mustard, Chickpea, Groundnut, Green gram/Black Gram should be completed. Deworming and vaccination in animals is recommended to boost immunity and protect them from diseases.

advisory: If rice is at maturity stage, stop irrigation in the field before harvesting.
Harvest the plants when 80-85% of the grains have matured and the plant looks pale yellow in color.
After harvesting, dry rice in the field for 2-3 days and then proceed with threshing. Store rice at a moisture level of 12% in safe places.
Regular monitoring for False Smut disease infestation in late maturing rice varieties is advised. If infestation is noticed, spraying of Copper hydroxide 77% or Tebuconazole 25% is recommended.
One week before sowing, treat seed with carbendazim and imidacloprid. After treatment, mix Rizobium culture and sodium molybdate in seeds. Sow seeds with a seed rate of 8-10 kg/ac.
Varieties: Green Gram - Kamadeva, Durga, IPM 02-3, IPM 02-14, TARM1.
One week before sowing, treat seed with carbendazim and imidacloprid. After treatment, mix Rizobium culture and sodium molybdate in seeds. Sow seeds with a seed rate of 8-10 kg/ac.
Varieties: Black Gram - Prasada, Usala, PU 31, IPU2-43, Mahuri.
Thin out plants to maintain plant population. Conduct hoeing and weeding operations in 15-20 day-old crops.
Sow improved groundnut varieties following seed treatment. Use bacteria or phospho culture for treatments. Sow seeds within 2-3 days of husking at a depth of 5 cm.
For seedlings older than 10 days, conduct gap filling where needed.
Use polythene or straw as mulching material during planting to maintain moisture and soil temperature.
Regular monitoring for Diamond back moth in cauliflower is advised. Consider using pheromone traps in the field.
Protect animals from cold during winter season and provide clean drinking water.
Keep animal sheds clean and free from urine or excreta to prevent flies.
Deworming and vaccination are recommended to control diseases. Consult with a qualified veterinary doctor if needed.
